Michael G. Black

Office sought: Justice on Montana Supreme Court.

Office salary: $124,949.

Political party: Nonpartisan.

Age: 52.

Birth place: Havre.

Home: Rural Granite County.

Occupation: Attorney and bureau chief of Civil Services Bureau, Montana Department of Justice, since 2013.

Family: Unmarried. Two children.

Education: Graduated from Havre High School, 1980; received bachelor’s degree, with high honors, from university of Montana, 1986; received juris doctor from Cornell University, Ithaca, N.Y., 1989.

Past employment: Associate, Lukins & Annis, Spokane and Coeur d’Alene offices, 1989-94; associate, Datsopoulos , MacDonald & Lind, Missoula, 1994-95; associate and then partner, Lukins & Annis, 1995-2002; sole practitioner, 2002-03; partner, Datsopoulos , MacDonald & Lind, 2003-04; sole member, Rock Creek Legal Services (doing business as Black Law Office), 2004-present; senior civil assistant attorney general, Montana Department of Justice, 2011-present.

Military: None.

Political experience: Lost race for trustee of Granite County Hospital District in Philipsburg in 2008, but was later appointed to job and served from 2009-11. Resigned to accept employment in Helena.
description: HELENA – Mike Black, an attorney in the state Department of Justice, is seeking appointment to be a justice on the Montana Supreme Court.
